author: tylerdoiron
title: Data Marketplace & Exchange Dapp
description: Businesses generate an abundance of new data everyday, stored in databases, without an idea of the demand/value for the data that they own.

f6_assessments.q0: Data is the new Oil. A project of such caliber is certain to grab some attention and there is gonna be a lot of demand considering that the item on sale is "Data". The businesses are gonna throw themselves to get their hands on something like "users data". This is gonna draw a lot of professionals onto the Cardano ecosystem, make them build applications on top of it to leverage the data available. The team mentions the challenges that are in front of them and seem to have mitigation methods, nonetheless how comfortable are the existing users of the application going to be knowing that their data is actually being sold; How is the team going to instill the trust and remove that hesitancy that might develop? There are no reservations regarding the impact this could have on businesses and the Cardano ecosystem, it's gonna be massive but I feel the team might have to look a little beyond and identify the other possible risks they might have to overcome during their voyage.
f6_assessments.q1: For the gravity of funding the team has requested which is about 3,25,000 making it more than 30% of the entire fund, there are a lot of details missing to the plain eye. The road-map is very brief with no well-defined milestones and deliverables. The timeline of 12 months in spite of being a long one, there sure are a lot of intermediate stage points missing. The team, however, looks propitious and bright but the cumulative years of experience would have added more insights to the mix and their capabilities. For the amount so huge, a detailed breakdown is looking very very vague and I as a reader would have appreciated if I was provided with a more elaborate how and where the funds are utilized. On the whole, I suggest the proposer goes back to the drawing board and comes back with a stage-wise development plan wherein they can ask for smaller funding and then approach the future rounds for more funds with some evident deliverables. This would be easier for the community considering the massive fund the team requires in making this proposal a reality.
f6_assessments.q2: For a proposal of such gravity, the KPIs sure seem dull. For a grand scheme, the proposer presents us with and the humungous funding required, a lot of important metrics seemed to have been forgotten. The proposer provides a few development metrics such as git commits, data availability, and a few business metrics such as revenue and quality partnerships which are surely come in handy, but monthly or quarterly measurable metrics that are aligned to the milestones the team sets and also in sync with the challenge's key metrics would have done the trick. But with the metrics currently defined, I have to slightly disagree that the audit process would be fruitful and fun. The proposal being a new one, these are some key points the community and voters would depend on to grasp the intensity of impact the proposal would deliver and how much of return of investment can be expected and hence I feel dainty more information regarding the KPIs can surely make this proposal a heavyweight in this challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: I recently heard a saying that goes something like "Data is the new oil", and this is because if the data is not really refined it cannot be exploited, just like oil. The author of the proposal argues that every day many businesses generate data without having the slightest idea of the demand and value of the same, for that is proposed to develop an on-chain marketplace that allows all interested parties the opportunity to buy and sell access to these off-chain data. Personally I see a clear alignment of the solution with Cardano, how? What is proposed is that what has to be in the blockchain is the access control, the buying and selling of access would be through tokens that I would understand will be native to Cardano. To improve this proposal I would recommend the author of the proposal to define which is the target market and which is the market share that is planned to be gained. In addition I think it is also necessary to define targets of the defined goals, for example, 1) "Discord/ community growth", I would ask him based on his experience what is the estimated number of users that will achieve engagement? 2) "(#) of Marketplace Transactions", also in this case I would ask him what is his estimation? Of course I understand that these are difficult values to estimate but I believe that this is part of the work that the community expects, much more considering the amount you are requesting. Another recommendation I would give is to address the topic of storage of the dataset that will be available on the platform, particularly everything associated with decentralized storage. Based on the above, I assign a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q1: The team assembled for this proposal comprises 4 people with different backgrounds relevant to the proposal presented, their skills and experience were verified through their linkeind profile. They do not have a developer with experience in Haskell / Plutus / Rust, etc. this seems to me a very important topic that was not addressed in the risk section mainly because I know that developers with that profile are highly demanded so I would have liked to read mitigation countermeasures regarding that risk. When analyzing the budget we found that this proposal requests a little more than 30% of the challenge budget and more than 90% of this will be destined to the payment of professional fees for the different profiles, although I consider that there was a correct description of the different items and the requested values are appropriate to the international market, I found several of these items that should have been better described, for example, it is assigned to marketing US$23,000 this would be why amount of time? The same for the value assigned for the frontend it is not clear the calculated hourly value. These details should have been more precise to allow a better evaluation by the community. When evaluating the implementation plan I found it a bit confusing, for example, it is indicated that in May 2022 " "Build MVP1". What does this mean?  Does it mean that construction will start? or the MVP will be finished? If the latter, you expect to build an MVP in 2 months? The same goes for point 4. It is not clear if by October 2022 you expect the deliverable. Here I can give you an additional recommendation in case you are not allocated funds this time, I would recommend you to split the project in two phases where the integration with DAOs is left for a second phase, and for that you can reapply for funds with already a MVP done. Based on this, I assign you a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q2: Finally in the Auditability section the author presents a video where you can see what I understand is a mockup of the application and it looks very interesting. Regarding the roadmap, it is presented in a period of 12 months, describing deliverables in milestones at 3 months and then between 6 and 12 months. Here I see an inconsistency with the challente setting since they ask the proposers to submit plans up to a period of 9 months, however, it is not very serious from my point of view. Regarding the definition of metrics / KPIs, it seems to me that they are well defined, concise and easy to measure. For the above described, I consider that this section has a score of 5.

f6_assessments.q0:
A new idea in the blockchain space is to encode supplier data into tokens that can be traded on the market. I have tried to read through all the attachments but there still seem to be many factors that keep me from understanding how you guys can implement this idea. My opinion is: 
1. How do you encode this data into tokens while the data source is off-chain? Will a 3rd party store this data and then convert it into a set of indexes and the Datatoken will simulate this index and put it on the chain? 
2. If the data is not on-chain, who controls the transparency of the data? When the data is changed, how will the Datatoken change? Hopefully, the above suggestions can help you provide more information to increase the basis for successful funding.
f6_assessments.q1:
Looking at the budget you are proposing, it seems to exceed 25% of the total budget of the B2B B2C Challenge, with a budget like this, I expect you can explain in more detail in the capital use plan such as: 

1. How many members do the smart contract development work in all? how much is the hourly rate? 
2. Project management will include what jobs? Budget details for each job? 
3. Marketing you will reach the target group is domestic or foreign customers, if abroad, how much is the specific cost?. An update that outlines these issues more clearly will give you more of a basis to successfully apply for capital.
f6_assessments.q2: In KPI, I encourage you to have a specific number to measure success. For example, you will gain the first 10 customers, or the average frequency of programmers publishing code on Github is 10 times/month. The community attracts 1000 members to follow and interact with the platform.

f6_assessments.q0: The proponent used a decentralized and exchange system for suppliers, businesses, and individuals to exchange, buy, and sell their own data in an open and transparent marketplace in the Blockchain. Go hand in hand and grow the Cardano business and ecosystem. The overall proposal meets the challenge. Besides, the team also considered, anticipated the risks and had a complete solution for the risks when implementing the proposal, I am confident with your proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal offers a complete plan, showing a detailed roadmap month by month: 3, 4, 5 and 10 in 2022 and projected to 2023. With a total budget of $325,000, I think it makes sense. for what is explained in your budget. The proposal presented enough evidence to demonstrate the skills and experience required by the team to implement the proposal. Create strong confidence for the success of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has clear milestones for 12 months. Detailed budget is broken down coherently and easily audited and tracked the successful progress of the proposal. The word plan shows each step of the project progress clearly. The success of the project can be seen.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal has presented the main function of their solution - Tilebase and its features to effectively operate. They explain how it gonna help businesses and individuals easily publish their data. Their solution is provided for data providers and data consumers to transparently transact data assets, directly affecting the Cardano community by creating a new asset class for the Cardano blockchain. They also discuss how their product will to go market after being completed, showing the community their clear vision for future development path of their project.
The main challenges are well anticipated, they also provide some active solutions to confront these problems. This part is written in a logical order and fairly sufficient. Therefore, the community can see that they thoroughly understand their project and have a good risk management.
f6_assessments.q1:
All the main tasks and subtasks along with specific periods of time are described in their action plan. The community can see what their project will accomplish and have a clear picture of the expected results.
Based on their delivery plan, they divide their budget for two main areas: tech and team. In each area, the cost for each component is well broken down. This ensures the clarity of their spending and is very easy for the community to track and follow the plan.
The team members are well listed with their roles in the project and highly relevant working experience showing their capacity to activate the project smoothly. The futute position is also mentioned.
f6_assessments.q2: The important indicators to effectively measure the performance of the project is presented. These metrics are well aligned with the plan, providing objective evidence of progress. ONe small suggestion of mine is that the proposers set the desired numbers for each KPI so that the community can based on these numbers to assess whether they achieve the desired results or not. They clearly visualize their success as well, showing their understanding and determination to achieve their ultimate goals.

f6_assessments.q0: A well-articulated and presented proposal that is perfectly suited to the challenge settings. The problem statement is simple to grasp, and the solution addresses it appropriately. The proposer proposes to build a decentralized data marketplace & exchange; utilizing a tokenized access control layer on Cardano to buy/sell the right to data off-chain. I enjoy the concept of success provided in the proposal, it's precise and well-explained. This idea is wonderful for this challenge and I feel that if successfully implemented, it will play an important role in the future to the community since such tooling is lacking. The important metrics like adoption is a valid one and it matches with the challenge settings. The proposers do identify potential future obstacles and problems, as well as possible solutions to overcome them, which I find sensible.
f6_assessments.q1: I was able to verify the team members and their indicated skills and experience necessary to implement the proposal by doing some LinkedIn research. The fact that they have provided their names gives me more confidence in their initiative, as team member links are indeed a vital tool in bringing legitimacy to a proposal. According to the presentations, this project has a sizable team working on it, with the type and quantity of team members already determined. The proposers also have a clear idea of the work that needs to be done as well as a timetable for completing it. The timetable established for all of the work appears to be reasonable. There is a very specific plan in place to increase voter trust. The budget is clearly laid out, and it appears to be realistic for the amount of work required for the project to succeed. It explains team salaries and timelines in months for the necessary work. It is implicitly recognized where the money will be spent and how much each expense will cost. However, I would advise the team to include additional information on the cost of the marketing field, as $23,000 is ambiguous and subjective. There are certain hazards and challenges mentioned, as well as potential answers to some of the roadblocks. Overall, it appears to be a viable project with a strong staff standing behind. Although there is certainly room for improvement, I am optimistic about its chances of success.
f6_assessments.q2: I was able to verify the team members and their indicated skills and experience necessary to implement the proposal by doing some LinkedIn research. The fact that they have provided their names gives me more confidence in their initiative, as team member links are indeed a vital tool in bringing legitimacy to a proposal. According to the presentations, this project has a sizable team working on it, with the type and quantity of team members already determined. The proposers also have a clear idea of the work that needs to be done as well as a timetable for completing it. The timetable established for all of the work appears to be reasonable. There is a very specific plan in place to increase voter trust. The budget is clearly laid out, and it appears to be realistic for the amount of work required for the project to succeed. It explains team salaries and timelines in months for the necessary work. It is implicitly recognized where the money will be spent and how much each expense will cost. However, I would advise the team to include additional information on the cost of the marketing field, as $23,000 is ambiguous and subjective. There are certain hazards and challenges mentioned, as well as potential answers to some of the roadblocks. Overall, it appears to be a viable project with a strong staff standing behind. Although there is certainly room for improvement, I am optimistic about its chances of success.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea is good (outside the box, I would say) and aligned with the challenge although some key metrics are still unmet. The proposal is very well structured. The challenge seeks to create a decentralized data marketplace and exchange that uses a tokenized access control layer on Cardano to buy and sell data rights off-chain and improve the Cardano ecosystem which aligns with the mission statement. It has a plus point since the team describes an entire section outlining the risks that were identified at the time, as well as the countermeasures that were implemented to reduce or eliminate them. All in all, the proposal does address the challenge, engaging and scaling up local communities, possibly bringing new members, and has the potential to raise different and fruitful discussions. However, I would only ask if I can see some specific number in the Key metrics section instead of bare words although I know it might be very difficult to do so.
f6_assessments.q1: There are numerous links and evidence supporting the proposer's identities and skill set. Some of them are active in community channels and are community leaders. They have a good idea of the team they need to form based on what they've already done, and they have a good idea of how long it will take to complete all of the phases outlined in the roadmap. The budget could have been better broken down because some of the project expenses are still unclear or appear to be more than necessary to me. There's a good explanation of how the project will be implemented and the overall process that will be followed. As a result, overall credibility improves. The technical aspects are correctly mentioned, but not in great detail because the proposal's analysis phase is still incomplete. The proposal is well thought out, and it is clear that a lot of effort has and will be put into it. The difficulties associated with a successful implementation have been considered. The project is in sync with what has already been done, and it intends to shape an evolving standard for ntf that can be used and verified easily via an open-source repository linked in the proposal. Overall, a viable project that I hope will be voted on!
f6_assessments.q2: I cannot agree or disagree that the information provided here is adequate to assess the progress and success of this proposal. For the most part, the key metrics are not measurable, but the success criteria are adequate, and the team has provided a good description of Quarterly milestones planning. To improve the challenge, better articulate how the success criteria address the challenge and how metrics can track progress toward the success criteria. It is also unclear whether this proposal is a continuation of a previously funded Catalyst project or an entirely new one. The information on whether this proposal is a continuation of a previously funded project in Catalyst or an entirely new one is missing too. I'd only ask if I could see a specific number rather than just words in the key metrics section, though I understand that this may be difficult.

f6_assessments.q0:
The project aims exactly at the target users of the challenge and the description of its functions was well-written.  
The team seems to know what their challenges are and have pretty clear solutions in mind. They even listed out the challenges and the solution for each of them.
f6_assessments.q1:
Their plan is detailed with the time included. However, there is no information on how this plan is going to be executed. For example how they will build/integrate data DAO and how many data sets are acceptable for this step.
The budget breakdown seems to be fair and thorough with the salaries of all roles.
The team members are qualified and have experience in their expertise. All of them have professional LinkedIn profiles which increase the team's credibility. But, they need a more specific description for the missing role: Blockchain developer. Requirements such as years of experience, level of the role (senior, Junior, etc) should be listed.
f6_assessments.q2: The progress measurement needs to be clearer. In the proposal, the team only has vague goals like community growth after 3 months, churn rate on SaaS after 6-12 months, etc. They should provide the estimated numbers to show that the project is successful. For example, the community grows to … users. Also, the link to TIBCO’s product is provided and this company seems trustable.

f6_assessments.q0: Derived from the management of data on the blockchain, there is no need to put information on the chain, but only need to control access. The working group proposed the development of a decentralized data management system on the cardano blockchain. Their customers are businesses and organizations willing to test new technology. Their difficulty is ensuring security and changing consumption habits, making it easier for consumers to accept cryptocurrencies and data management technology through blockchain. This is to support and promote systems related to data management, online business, financial management, administrative enforcement... completely by blockchain in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: They are experienced software engineers. They combine with 2 other reputable engineering organizations. In addition, their members have experienced advisors on Oracle, information security... This is a premise confirming that the project is feasible within their reach. Also they have a very clear plan to build a decentralized data management platform step by step. They also detailed the expenditures showing their transparent projections. Hope the project is interested by the community and receives support.
f6_assessments.q2: They go public on github and are committed to developing the code with completely open source code for the community to follow. In addition, they cooperate with a number of scientific and technical researchers to regularly provide detailed assessments and reports to standardize and fully report this progress. This shows the project's reliability. Hopefully they will pursue to the end so that the cardano platform has an exemplary data management system, as a premise for broader applications of blockchain and crypto.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal introduces a decentralized solution on the Cardano platform to provide data for an open and transparent market. Users can access the data they need through Datatoken, which can be exchanged in the market. The solution helps to increase the benefits of data providers, leading to scale up opportunity for the data provider market. This means an increase in the number of transactions on the Cardano platform and more people recognize its value.
This is a significant proposal in the field of data mining basing on blockchain platform. The Integration with data providers, data validators; establisment data sources to the market and effectively operation the platform, requires lot of time and cost. But it will bring benefits to all data providers, users and those holding Datatoken.
This proposal addresses the tasks of Challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal provides roadmap in detail with each timeline. The achievement results are clear, but I’d like the proposer to add a marketing plan because it is very valuable to the community.
Regarding the proposed budget, in my opinion these are reasonable costs and works. This is a very cool and valuable project for the community. It will take a lot of work, time and costs. I’d like to suggest the proposer to break it down into specific phases or tasks to easily meet Catalyst fund requirements.
This proposal has many technological challenges. And they have strong team, who are experts with deep skills in database, cloud and security. Also they have engineers specializing in blockchain, application designing, .. This is a team with high executive ability and make the project well feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal’s KPIs are selected and clearly provided. The proposal also has a clear development progress, the work results are presented in detail figures. It makes the project well auditability.

solution: A decentralized data marketplace & exchange; using a tokenized access control layer on Cardano to buy/sell the right to data off-chain.
experience: Our team consists of senior full stack engineers, members who have built patents in data integrity and cybersecurity through digital ledger, and have published top rated/ best-selling Udemy courses based on creational design patterns and Spring Boot framework.
